channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can media-company spinoffs of brands like CNN and CNBC be good for investors? Here’s what history tells us.
item.description: Recent corporate media spinoffs have been a mixed bag, with many failing due to the way they were set up, Wall Street analysts say.

item.title: Don’t count on an inheritance: Baby boomers are hanging on to their money
item.description: How to tell your children you plan to “die with zero.”

item.title: Aethir enables better user acquisition via Instant Play streaming for Doctor Who: Worlds Apart
item.description: Aethir provides better computing efficiency with its Instant Play streaming solution for Doctor Who: Worlds Apart.

item.title: What on earth is going on with the American consumer?
item.description: U.S. workers are not sure whether to buy that new car — or brace for a recession.

item.title: Model Context Protocol: A promising AI integration layer, but not a standard (yet)
item.description: Enterprises should experiment with MCP where it adds value, isolate dependencies and prepare for a multi-protocol future.

item.title: Micro Center nerd store fills the Fry’s vacuum with its return to Silicon Valley
item.description: Micro Center, an electronics retailer, has opened a store in Silicon Valley in California And so the nerd kingdom has returned.
